I have been protecting antiquities all my life. I felt if the Cairo museum is robbed, Egypt will never be able to get up again. Early Saturday, Zahi Hawass made his way through the crowds to reach the museum. He gathered students and others protesting in the streets and rallied them to the building in central Cairo. Later Monday, he was appointed Minister of State Antiquities in the new government named by President Hosni Mubarak , who faces calls from protesters for his ouster. If the museum is safe, Egypt is safe, Zahi Hawass said. A museum administrator found the head of a small clay statue on the stairs.
